title: Wild Thing 1-7 (1993) [Marvel UK]
description:
English | CBZ and CBR | 7 Issues

Wild Thing #1-7
Publisher:  Marvel UK
Publication Date:  April - October 1993

Writers:  Simon Jowett (#1-6) and Sue Smith (#7)
Pencilers:  Duke Mighten (#1-6) and Bryan Hitch (#7)
Inkers:  Duke Mighten (#1-2, 4), Anthony Adhikary (#3, 5-6), John Moulds (#7), Martin Griffiths (#7), and Richard Dolan (#7)
Colorists:  Steve Whitaker (#1-4, 6-7) and Leslie Dalton (#5)
Letterers:  Elitta Fell (#1), Caroline Steeden (#2-5), and Woodrow Phoenix (#7)
Cover Artist:  Duke Mighten

Wild Thing #1
When Wild Thing, Nikki Doyle, meets up with Virtual Reality incarnations of Venom and Carnage, the destruction of the VR Marvel Universe becomes a nightmare all too real.

Wild Thing #2
While Nikki frantically searches for an addict trapped inside the Virtual Reality world, VR Venom is hot on her heels.

Wild Thing #3
Introducing Death Duty! Nikki emerges from the wreckage of a Virtual Reality den to discover that S.H.I.E.L.D. is alive and dangerous and has unfinished business with her boss. Written by Simon Jowett. Pencils and cover by Duke Mighten.

Wild Thing #4
Dark Thing vs. Liddel! Nikki hunts down the source of the deadly Virtual Reality programs, while other forces plot to exploit her special talents. Written by Simon Jowett. Art and cover by Duke Mighten.

Wild Thing #5
Does Nikki Doyle find love, or is it just an illusion? Find out when she goes undercover and encounters Virtual Reality hopping street gangs. Written by Simon Jowett. Pencils and cover by Duke Mighten.

Wild Thing #6
This issue has an outrageous wraparound cover, featuring Kraven, Mysterio, Electro, Doctor Octopus, the Vulture and more. Nikki battles the VR incarnations of Spider-Man's worst enemies and the real Mysterio. Written by Simon Jowett. Pencils and cover by Duke Mighten.

Wild Thing #7
Only one person can save the world from destruction, and she's gone AWOL. When Nikki Doyle accepts an old friend's invitation to play an illegal VR game, Trout and Liddel race the clock to find her in time. Pencils by Bryan Hitch. Cover by Duke Mighten.

*All credit goes to the scanners*
